ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The sun and the moon both run with precision.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The sun and moon revolve to a computation;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The sun and the moon follow a reckoning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The sun and moon rotate in a predestined orbit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The sun and the moon are scheduled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The sun and the moon (run) on fixed courses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The sun and the moon follow a reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: The sun and the moon to a reckoning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The sun and the moon are made punctual.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The sun and the moon move according to a fixed reckoning;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The sun and the moon are in a reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The sun and the moon are [disposed] calculatedly,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The sun and the moon follow courses (exactly) computed;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The sun and the moon run on their fixed courses (exactly) calculated with measured out stages for each (for reckoning, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The sun and the moon to a reckoning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The sun and the moon move according to plan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:5] The sun and the moon follow a reckoning, they move according to a [strict] calculation,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The sun and the moon are made punctual) their orbits are measured; and it is also said that this means: they are suspended half way between heaven and earth; and it is also said that this means: they both will be taken to task and have a lifespan like the lifespan of human beings.
